page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY 9
page.content:
At the turn of the century, despite the emergence of{industry}in the area, Hope and Caergwrle seemed to be recognised mainly as picturesque and attractive villages. Their{landscape} was captured in many explorers' writings, such as a poem written by Anne Clegg in 1899 simply entitled 'Caergwrle'.
The natural beauty offered by the area prompted the emergence of another{ {industry}-{tourism}- which was not fully exploited until the 1930's. Hope and Caergwrle's popularity, especially with visitors from Merseyside, primarily stemmed from the revitalisation of the Caergwrle wells. {(Local history)}
